pullRequest.title: Migrate JPA Locking Tests
pullRequest.bodyText: This migrates the JPA EntityLocking tests to Open Liberty, as well as lays down the foundation for moving the JPA test framework to a shared project.  When rolled out to the other JPA buckets, this will eliminate a lot of duplicate code and ensure that every test bucket is running with the same version of the framework code.

commit.message:
Migrate JPA Locking Tests

Signed-off-by: Joe Grassel <jgrassel@us.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Migrate JPA Locking Tests

commit.message:
Fix copyright headers as per code review for #14235

Signed-off-by: Joe Grassel <jgrassel@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: I dont think the cleanup resource is even used; we use the DROP DDL instead. I think this can be removed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,179 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<!-- 
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *
+ * Contributors:
+ *     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+-->
+<ejb-jar id="ejb-jar_id" 
+        xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee"
+        xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+        xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee/ejb-jar_3_1.xsd"
+        metadata-complete="false" version="3.1">
+  <enterprise-beans>
+     <session>
+        <ejb-name>StatefulMessengerClient</ejb-name>
+        <business-local>com.ibm.ws.testtooling.msgcli.smc.StatefulMessengerClient</business-local>
+        <ejb-class>com.ibm.ws.testtooling.msgcli.smc.StatefulMessengerClientBean</ejb-class>
+        <session-type>Stateful</session-type>
+        <remove-method>
+            <bean-method>
+                <method-name>close</method-name>
+            </bean-method>
+        </remove-method>
+        
+        <!-- JMS Connection Factories -->
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPA_QCF</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.QueueConnectionFactory</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPA_TCF</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.TopicConnectionFactory</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>
+          
+        <!-- JMS Resources for Client A and Client B Communication -->
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_XMit_CliB_Recv_Queue</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.Queue</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_Recv_CliB_Xmit_Queue</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.Queue</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_XMit_CliB_Recv_Topic</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.Topic</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>
+        <resource-ref>
+            <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_Recv_CliB_Xmit_Topic</res-ref-name>
+            <res-type>javax.jms.Topic</res-type>
+            <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+            <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+        </resource-ref>            
+     </session>
+     
+     <message-driven>
+            <ejb-name>EntityLocking20MDB</ejb-name>
+            <ejb-class>com.ibm.ws.testtooling.vehicle.mdb.MDBTestVehicle</ejb-class>
+            <activation-config>
+                <activation-config-property>
+                    <activation-config-property-name>destinationType</activation-config-property-name>
+                    <activation-config-property-value>javax.jms.Topic</activation-config-property-value>
+                </activation-config-property>
+                <activation-config-property>
+                    <activation-config-property-name>acknowledgeMode</activation-config-property-name>
+                    <activation-config-property-value>Auto-acknowledge</activation-config-property-value>
+                </activation-config-property>
+                <activation-config-property>
+                    <activation-config-property-name>destination</activation-config-property-name>
+                    <activation-config-property-value>EntityLocking10/EntityLockingEJB/EntityLocking20MDB</activation-config-property-value>
+                </activation-config-property>
+            </activation-config>
+
+            <!-- env-entry to self identity MDB definition -->
+            <env-entry>
+                <env-entry-name>beanName</env-entry-name>
+                <env-entry-type>java.lang.String</env-entry-type>
+                <env-entry-value>EntityLocking20MDB</env-entry-value>
+            </env-entry>
+      
+            <!-- JMS Connection Factories -->
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPA_QCF</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.QueueConnectionFactory</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPA_TCF</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.TopicConnectionFactory</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            
+            <!-- JMS Resources for MDB Invocation/Reply Reception -->
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_Topic</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.Topic</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_ReplyQueue</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.Queue</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            
+            <!-- JMS Resources for Client A and Client B Communication -->
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_XMit_CliB_Recv_Queue</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.Queue</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jms/JPAFVT_CliA_Recv_CliB_Xmit_Queue</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.jms.Queue</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            
+            <!-- JDBC Resources -->
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jdbc/JPA_DS</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            <resource-ref>
+                <res-ref-name>jdbc/JPA_NJTADS</res-ref-name>
+                <res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>
+                <res-auth>Container</res-auth>
+                <res-sharing-scope>Shareable</res-sharing-scope>
+            </resource-ref>
+            
+            <ejb-local-ref>
+                <ejb-ref-name>ejb/StatefulMessengerClient</ejb-ref-name>
+                <local>com.ibm.ws.testtooling.msgcli.smc.StatefulMessengerClient</local>
+                <ejb-link>StatefulMessengerClient</ejb-link>
+            </ejb-local-ref>
+    
+            <!-- JPA Resources -->
+            <persistence-context-ref>
+                <persistence-context-ref-name>jpa/EntityLock_CMTS</persistence-context-ref-name>
+                <persistence-unit-name>EntityLock_JTA</persistence-unit-name>
+                <persistence-context-type>Transaction</persistence-context-type>
+            </persistence-context-ref>
+            <persistence-unit-ref>
+                <persistence-unit-ref-name>jpa/EntityLock_AMJTA</persistence-unit-ref-name>
+                <persistence-unit-name>EntityLock_JTA</persistence-unit-name>
+            </persistence-unit-ref>
+            <persistence-unit-ref>
+                <persistence-unit-ref-name>jpa/EntityLock_AMRL</persistence-unit-ref-name>
+                <persistence-unit-name>EntityLock_RL</persistence-unit-name>
+            </persistence-unit-ref> 
+            <persistence-unit-ref>

nodes.bodyText: Why is it entitylocking20 if this is a jpa_spec10_locking FAT project?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials

+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at

+#

+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+src: \
+    fat/src,\
+    test-applications/EntityLocking/src,\
+    test-applications/helpers/DatabaseManagement/src
+
+fat.project: true
+fat.test.databases: true
+tested.features: jdbc-4.0, beanvalidation-1.1, jpa-2.0, el-3.0, jpa-3.0, servlet-5.0, cdi-3.0, beanValidation-3.0, enterpriseBeansLite-4.0

nodes.bodyText: This test appears to be testing a JPA 2.0 API feature, is that correct? Should this test be moved to the jpa20 spec FAT?

commit.message:
Changes as per code review for #14235

Signed-off-by: Joe Grassel <jgrassel@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: It looks like this database.xml isnt included in the server.xml. Do you think server.xml should be updated to include this file? or should this just be deleted?

nodes.bodyText: Is populateSet missing? I see there is a dev/com.ibm.ws.jpa_locking_fat/test-applications/EntityLocking/ddl/WEB-INF/classes/JPA_ENTITYLOCKING_POPULATE_DERBY.ddl. Is this needed to be run?

commit.message:
Remove unnecessary copy of test-framework from com.ibm.ws.jpa_locking_fat project.

Signed-off-by: Joe Grassel <jgrassel@us.ibm.com>
